title: Cat. 55  Punch Bowl, 1873
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Tiffany & Co. (American, founded 1837)  
Chasing by Eugene J. Soligny (American, c. 1833–1901)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 41.9 × diam. 67.3 cm (16 1/2 × diam. 26 1/2 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Mr. and Mrs. William Y. Hutchinson Fund, 1985.221.3

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 55.1)

Engraved on body: The United States of America / Viscount d’Itajubá / His Majesty, the Emperor of Brazil / Article 1 of the Treaty Between the United States and Her Britannic Majesty / Concluded at Washington May 8, 1871 as a Mark of Their Appreciation of the / Dignity, Learning, Ability and Impartiality with Which He Discharged His Arduous Duties at / Geneva (fig. 55.2)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Viscount d’Itajubá (1805–1884).

By descent to Baron von Jenisch of Hamburg (d. 1985), by 1985.

With Sotheby’s (1985), lot 19.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1985.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Vienna, International Exposition, 1873.

Dallas Museum of Art, Silver in America: A Century of Splendor, 1840–1940, November 6, 1994–January 29, 1995, p. 64, fig. 3-1 (ill.).

Pittsburgh, Carnegie Museum of Art, March 12–May 21, 1995.

Milwaukee (WI) Museum of Art, June 18–August 13, 1995.

Wilmington, DE, Henry Francis du Pont Winterthur Museum, September 9, 1995–January 7, 1996.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art-Journal (1873), pp. 245, 252 (ill.).

Frank Leslie’s Illustrated Newspaper (1878), p. 1.

W. Smith (1880), p. 237 (ill.).

Sotheby’s (1985), lot 19.

Morse (1986), p. 15 (ill.).

Naeve et al. (1986), pp. 90–91, cat. 68 (ill.).

C. Carpenter and Zapata (1987), p. 53, cat. 7a–b.

Armstrong (1988), pp. 822–35, 828 (ill.).

Venable (1995), p. 64, fig. 3.19 (ill.).

Thayer (1996), pp. 1, 8 (ill.).

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 220–23, cat. 103.

Loring (2001), pp. 124–25 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Punch Bowl, 1873.

fig. 55.1 fig. 55.2 </section>
